bibl.title: Letter from S.C. Mead to Mabel H. Lazear, March 31, 1908

div1.p: Mead reports that the bill passed by the Senate will grant pensions to the widows of Lazear and Carroll.

Dear Madam:
div1.p:
We take much pleasure in quoting to you the opening para-
graph of a special telegram to the New York World, as it appears
in this morning's issue, as follows:

“Washington, Mar. 30th.--The widows of Dr. James
Carroll and Jesse W. Lazear, U. S. A., are granted a pension
of $125. a month each by a Bill which passed the Senate.”

The measure was probably adopted by the Senate at its session yester-
day. It will now go over into the House of Representatives, where
we shall put forth every effort to secure favorable action thereon,
in order that it may get to the President for signature at the earl-
iest possible date.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, THE MERCHANTS' ASSOCIATION OF NEW YORK,
By S C Mead, F.
Secretary.
